casebody.data:
678 A.2d 1050 ATTORNEY GRIEVANCE COMMISSION OF MARYLAND v. John GREEN, Jr. Misc. (Subtitle BV), No. 18,

Sept. Term, 1996.

Court of Appeals of Maryland. July 11, 1996.

ORDER

The Court having considered the Petition for Indefinite Suspension by Consent filed jointly by the Attorney Grievance Commission and John Green, Jr., the respondent, it is this 11th day of July, 1996,

ORDERED, by the Court of Appeals of Maryland, that the petition be, and it is hereby, GRANTED and the respondent, John Green, Jr., is suspended indefinitely by consent from the practice of law in Maryland pending further order of this Court, and it is further

ORDERED, that the Clerk of this Court shall strike the name of John Green, Jr. from the register of attorneys, and pursuant to Maryland Rule BV13, shall certify that fact to the Trustees of the Clients’ Security Trust Fund and the clerks of all judicial tribunals in the State.
